member.returns: the Fourier transformation of the samples

member.summary: Recursively compute the complex fast Fourier transform of an array. Implemented using a recursive implementation of the Cooley-Tukey radix-2 algorithm: O(n log n)
member.param: array of complexArray (size should be padded with zeros to a length of the first power of 2 equal to or greater than the intial length
member.returns: the discrete Fourier transformation of the complexArray

member.name: M:AI.Signals.FurCor.FFT.DoInverseFFT(AI.ComplexVector)
member.summary: Recursively compute an inverse complex fast Fourier transform of an array. Implemented using a recursive implementation of the Cooley-Tukey radix-2 algorithm: O(n log n)
member.param: array of complexArray (size should be padded with zeros to a length of the first power of 2 equal to or greater than the intial length
member.returns: the fourier transformation of the complexArray

member.name: M:AI.Signals.FurCor.FFT.FindSampleOffset(System.IO.MemoryStream,System.IO.MemoryStream)
member.summary: Finds the relative offset in # of samples between two PCM/wav files
member.param: A memory stream the emitted test signal PCM data
A memory stream of the PCM data of the captured result
member.returns: The number of samples between the click in memoryStreamX and that of memoryStreamY

member.name: M:AI.Signals.FurCor.FFT.IsPowerOfTwo(System.Int64)
member.summary: Checks if a number is a power of two. Handles the 0 and negative value cases.
member.returns: true if the parameter represents a power of two, false otherwise

member.name: M:AI.Signals.FurCor.FFT.ResizeAndZeroPad(System.Numerics.Complex[],System.Int32)
member.summary:
Right-pad the array length with zeros to the first power of 2 which is either A) equal to or greater than twice the original array length (default behavior - 'targetSamples' set to 0), or B) equal to or greater than twice the length specified by the 'targetSamples' parameter, if the integer passed is greater than the original array length
~~ note on second parameter ~~ - the 'targetSamples' parameter specifies the minimum number of samples from which to resize and zero-pad. This is useful when convolving a long signal with a short impulse response. - it only has an effect if a value greater than the original array length is passed
member.param: minimum number of samples from which to size the padded array (0 == default behavior)

member.name: M:AI.Signals.FurCor.FFT.NecessarySignificantBits(System.Int32)
member.summary: Compute the number of significant bits required to store a number (the first sufficiently large power of 2)
member.returns: minimum number of bits necessary to store the number

member.name: M:AI.Signals.Signal.Energe(AI.Vector,System.Double)
member.summary: Энергия выделяемая на едичном резисторе за все время

member.name: M:AI.Signals.Signal.Perediscr(AI.Vector,System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Передискретизация сигнала (повышение частоты дискретизации в целое число раз)
member.returns: Вектор тойже длительности, что и входной, но с более высокой частотой дискретизации
